frameDefinitions: In this frame a Fluid moves from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.  '
An Entity loses moisture with the outcome of being in a dry state.
These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
In this frame a Patient undergoes a change of phase.
frameExamples: Robin <t>sold</t> a car to Abby for $5,000.
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Area</fen> is the setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place on an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up.
The <fen>Path</fen> is the trajectory along which the <fen>Fluid</fen> moves.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> occupies initially.
The <fen>Fluid</fen> is the entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fluid</fen> flows.
The Place describes the location of the motion which has a specified Source, Path or Goal.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the thing that loses moisture and becomes dry.
When the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes dry.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes dry.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to change phase.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase brought about by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the Time at which the change of phase occurs.
This role identifies the place where change of phase occurs.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change of phase.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
Where the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
listRoleExamples: <fex>At Oregon Caves</fex>, a stream runs through the dining room.
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has sold more than three million copies.
